articles.author: Staff
articles.title: Trump’s “Compact for Academic Excellence” Threatens University Independence.
articles.description: (ThyBlackMan.com) It’s called the “Compact for Academic Excellence in Higher Education.” It is anything but. It asks the schools who received Wednesday’s letter to give up their academic freedom and adopt the right-wing partisan platform on education in exchange for preferred access to federal funding. Of course, the document points out (as it must) that “institutions of higher education are free to develop models and values other than those” in the memo, if the institution elects to forgo federal benefits. Up until now, the administration has used the stick...

articles.author: AP News
articles.title: Cooper’s second half goal gives the Current a 1-0 win over Angel City
articles.description: Michelle Cooper scored in the 59th minute and the Kansas City Current extended their unbeaten run to 16 straight matches with a 1-0 victory over Angel City on Monday night in the National Women’s Soccer League. It was a league record 19th win this season for the first-place Current, who have already clinched a playoff spot and the NWSL Shield. It was also Kansas City's 10th win on the road. The loss snapped a three game unbeaten streak at home for Angel City.

articles.title: The architecture of lies: Bot farms are running the disinformation war
articles.description: Bot farms have moved into the center of information warfare, using automated accounts to manipulate public opinion, influence elections, and weaken trust in institutions. Algorithms reward noise over truth Thales reports that in 2024, automated bot traffic made up 51% of all web traffic, the first time in a decade it has surpassed human activity online. As bots become more common and harder to tell from real users, people start to lose confidence in what … More →The post The architecture of lies: Bot farms are running the disinformation war appeared first on Help Net Security.

Chuck Edwards is voicing his concerns about the ongoing government shutdown as it nears the one-week mark.The Republican congressman, who represents the state's 11th congressional district, told News 13 that he and his colleagues are attempting to persuade five Senate Democrats to support their plan to reopen the government.Edwards also said that China, Russia, Iran, and North Korea are "amazed" that the U.S. government has been shut down."Our adversaries do not have that," Edwards said. articles.description: (ThyBlackMan.com) The Manhattans defined what it means to blend heart and harmony into pure soul. From Jersey City to stages around the world, they transformed emotion into sound — crafting songs where smooth vocals, orchestral arrangements, and slow-burning grooves met poetic storytelling. Led by Gerald Alston, their blend of silky leads and rich background harmonies became a blueprint for romantic R&B.Every track they recorded felt like a performance of sincerity, built on phrasing, balance, and tone.
